content.description: Cross start on pocket and crimp, work your way up the arete with an undercling and some fancy footwork.After topping out, walk down on left side of boulder.

This route is a traverse Start is the same as Remy’s spuddies with low feet to the right then right hand goes up to a 2 finger pocket and left hand goes to the left onto a decent hold with a thumb catch re - position feet and stretch your left hand out pretty far into another 2 finger pocket bring left foot farther out onto what’s basically a smear and you will be in the splits cross right hand under left onto a crimp and use pockets all the way up to Where 1.5 kids finished.After topping out, walk down on left side of boulder.
content.location: Past amusement wall on the right side of the trail

content.description: Sit start on the large flake and follow the arete to the top using the occasional foot and hand hold on the left face.After topping out, walk down on left side of boulder.
content.protection: a pad and a spotter to keep you from rolling down the hill
content.location: farthest route on the right of the boulder

content.description: Start right crimp, left side pull. Long move up and finish on 1.5 Kids' topout.After topping out, walk down on left side of boulder.
content.location: Between Uptight Neighbors and 1.5 Kids on Suburban.

content.description: Start on opposing side pulls, crimp up and long reach to layback. Stay right of arete and don't use mossy steps on left for topout. Fun feet! After topping out, walk down on left side of boulder.
Small boulder on right side of trail east of Amusement wall. Shady all day but early morning sun will get in your eyes. Good limestone crimps and pockets. Not as mossy as the old pictures show.
